alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Clearfield; Fulton; Huntingdon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 7:39PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF BEDFORD...FULTON... CLEARFIELD...BLAIR...CAMBRIA...AND HUNTINGDON COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to around one quarter mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 738 PM EDT, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Punxsutawney to 12 miles southwest of Hollidaysburg to near Paw Paw and moving east at 25 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Claysburg, Queen and Roaring Spring around 745 PM EDT. New Enterprise around 750 PM EDT. Martinsburg around 755 PM EDT. Shy Beaver and Entriken around 810 PM EDT. Coaldale around 815 PM EDT. Dudley around 820 PM EDT. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 70 from mile markers 147 to 170. The Pennsylvania Turnpike from mile markers 134 to 176. Interstate 99 from mile markers 0 to 33. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may be encountered. &&

area.areaDesc: Bedford; Blair; Cambria; Clearfield; Fulton; Huntingdon
